title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Since I can remember, cricket has been a way of life. It let me express myself, stay active, and build lifelong friendships. Every summer ‚Äî whether in Ireland or visiting Pakistan ‚Äî I‚Äôd spend hours playing, often with family and friends.
But cricket was never just a game. It was a dream. And dreams demand hard work.
Over the last year, I‚Äôve taken things seriously: analyzing technique, reviewing matches, and working on both my physical game and mental mindset.

title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Since I can remember, cricket has been a way of life. It let me express myself, stay active, and build lifelong friendships. Every summer ‚Äî whether in Ireland or visiting Pakistan ‚Äî I‚Äôd spend hours playing, often with family and friends.
But cricket was never just a game. It was a dream. And dreams demand hard work.
Over the last year, I‚Äôve taken things seriously: analyzing technique, reviewing matches, and working on both my physical game and mental mindset.

title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Performance Metrics & Stats
Over the last two seasons, I‚Äôve represented Carlow (2023) and moved to North County (2024). This move was about growth ‚Äî playing higher-level cricket and pushing myself beyond comfort zones.
Here‚Äôs how my performance evolved:


North County (2024)









Carlow (2023)









Interpreting the Journey
Moving from Division 16 at Carlow to Division 4 at North County was a 12-division leap in one year ‚Äî something I‚Äôm incredibly proud of.
My total runs jumped from 267 in 2023 to 567 in 2024, with a major bump in batting average ‚Äî all while facing better bowlers on tougher wickets.
The data helped me massively: - High LBW rates in 2023 told me my head was falling across the stumps. - I used that to fix my alignment, improve balance, and find more consistency.

title: Laeeq‚Äôs Cricketing Journey
text:
Reflection
Every season teaches something new. This time, I brought in coding to visualize my stats, study my dismissals, and shape my goals.
It‚Äôs helped me improve technically, mentally, and tactically ‚Äî and it‚Äôs only the beginning.

‚ÄúCricket‚Äôs taught me to stay grounded, stay hungry, and use setbacks as stepping stones.‚Äù

title: Academic projects

Vietnamese Sim
  

This project involved developing a simulation model for Vietnamese coffee‚Äêsupply‚Äêchain management. I used Python (in Spyder) to run simulation tests and examine how different events‚Äîsuch as prolonged monsoons‚Äîcould affect production.

title: Academic projects
text:
WaterWize
  

WaterWize‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääour NED project‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääturns slow water testing into instant checks. Our pocket-sized device spots Legionella in seconds and beams results to your phone. Think of it as a Fitbit for your water system‚Ää‚Äî‚Ääalways on, always watching.
Click On The Image To Read The Full Report!

title: Academic projects
section: Predicting Heart Disease Using Machine Learning
text:
Predicting Heart Disease Using Machine Learning
  

This individual project involved building and evaluating classification models to predict heart disease using the Cleveland dataset. I implemented Logistic Regression, SVM, and Random Forest in Python, and compared performance using metrics such as F1 score, recall, and ROC AUC.


The focus was on balancing predictive accuracy with interpretability. I also produced a 3,000-word reflective report covering methodology, KPI analysis, and the ethical context of using AI in healthcare.
Click the image to read the full report.

title: Achievements
text: As captain of the CBS hurling team, I led our school with pride and commitment. This role taught me responsibility, communication, and leadership both on and off the field. In my final year we won the South leinster final , which was unbelievable and is one of my most memorable memories from secondary school.

title: Achievements

In my final year we won the South leinster final , which was unbelievable and is one of my most memorable memories from secondary school.

title: Achievements
text:
DCU Access Scholarship
  

Being awarded the Scholarship was one of the proudest moments of my academic journey. This scholarship is given to students from the Access programme who have shown outstanding academic achievement, resilience, and promise. Coming from an Access background, I understood the weight of this recognition. It was more than a financial award ‚Äî it was a statement that my hard work and consistency mattered. I was deeply honoured to be seen as someone worthy of carrying that legacy forward.

title: Achievements
section: Ann Award ‚Äì Student of the Year
text:
Ann Award ‚Äì Student of the Year
  

The Ann award was especially meaningful to me. Voted by my peers in 6th year at CBS, it recognized the person in our year who best embodied kindness, support, and being a genuinely ‚Äúsound‚Äù individual. What made this even more touching was that I started secondary school knowing no one. To end it with this kind of recognition showed me how far I‚Äôd come ‚Äî not just academically, but socially and personally. As part of receiving the award, I had the honour of delivering a speech in front of the entire student body and their parents at our end-of-year ceremony. Receiving a standing ovation at the end was something I‚Äôll never forget ‚Äî it was truly amazing.

title: About Me
text:
Hello! I‚Äôm Laeeq Ur Rehman, a final-year Business Studies student at Dublin City University, working toward a First-Class Honours degree. I have a passion for technology, leadership, and sustainability, with hands-on experience in academic research, technical projects, public speaking, and entrepreneurship.
My journey blends business thinking with technical skills, leadership roles, and a continuous drive to improve myself and those around me.

title: About Me
text:
My Cricket Journey



Cricket shaped who I am. I‚Äôve progressed through clubs and divisions, growing both mentally and physically.
I now use data-driven self-analysis to track my performances, refine technique, and lead by example.

title: About Me
text:
My Business Hustle ‚Äì EVCIM




EVCIM is a recycled weights business I co-founded ‚Äî transforming scrap into smart, sustainable products.
I handled everything from design and manufacturing to customer outreach and backend automation.
This project taught me how to build from the ground up, with limited resources but limitless drive.

title: About Me
text:
Work Experience


For over 4 years, I worked at Golden Grill in Carlow ‚Äî a family-owned Italian restaurant.
I gained hands-on experience in customer service, stock management, and kitchen operations during peak hours.


It taught me the value of consistency, clear communication, and staying calm under pressure.

title: Future Pathway: Pursuing a Career in Cricket and Business
text:
With a strong foundation in cricket and an entrepreneurial mindset, my future pathway is shaped by both athletic ambition and business vision.
From a young age, cricket has been more than just a game for me ‚Äî it‚Äôs been a way of life.
As I continue to develop my skills, my next big goal is to pursue cricket professionally.
To achieve this, I am planning to train even harder, push my physical and mental limits, and potentially explore opportunities to train abroad, where I can be exposed to higher competition and better facilities.
I believe that challenging myself in new environments will accelerate my growth and help me reach international standards.
At the same time, I‚Äôm not just building my career on the field ‚Äî I‚Äôm also building it off the field.
Through this web development project (as part of my academic work), I‚Äôve realised how valuable technical skills can be in growing a personal brand or business.
Going forward, I intend to launch my own cricket coaching business or cricket-related initiative.
Building a professional website for it ‚Äî using the skills I gained during this module ‚Äî will be one of my first steps.
Having an online presence will allow me to showcase my journey, attract clients, and expand my impact beyond just local communities.
Ultimately, my goal is to blend my passion for cricket with entrepreneurship, creating a career where I can lead, inspire, and keep growing ‚Äî both on the pitch and in business.


Find out more about my journey ‚Üí
Explore the projects and skills I‚Äôve developed ‚Üí

title: Vietnamese Coffee Supply Chain Simulation
text:
This project simulates key stages of the Vietnamese coffee supply chain: farming, processing, transportation, and warehousing.
It helps understand how production delays, transport times, and warehouse capacity affect the overall system efficiency.

title: Vietnamese Coffee Supply Chain Simulation
text:
Simulation Code
import simpy
import pandas as pd
import random

# Constants
SIMULATION_TIME = 365  # days (1 year)
PRODUCTION_CAPACITY = 100  # tons of coffee per month per farm
PROCESSING_COST_PER_TON = 50  # USD per ton
TRANSPORT_COST_PER_KM = 1  # USD per kilometer per ton
WAREHOUSE_CAPACITY = 500  # tons
TRANSPORT_DISTANCE = 200  # km from processing to export port
EXPORT_TARIFF = 0.05  # 5% of export value
COFFEE_PRICE_PER_TON = 1200  # USD on the international market

# Farmer Class
class Farmer:
    def __init__(self, env, production_capacity):
        self.env = env
        self.production_capacity = production_capacity
        self.coffee_ready = 0
        self.production_process = env.process(self.produce_coffee())

    def produce_coffee(self):
        while True:
            yield self.env.timeout(30)  # 1 month production cycle
            self.coffee_ready += random.uniform(0.8, 1.2) * self.production_capacity
            print(f"Day {self.env.now}: Farmer produced {self.coffee_ready} tons of coffee.")

# Processing Facility Class
class ProcessingFacility:
    def __init__(self, env, processing_cost_per_ton):
        self.env = env
        self.processing_cost_per_ton = processing_cost_per_ton

    def process_coffee(self, coffee_amount):
        processing_cost = coffee_amount * self.processing_cost_per_ton
        yield self.env.timeout(10)  # Processing time for each batch
        print(f"Day {self.env.now}: Processed {coffee_amount} tons at cost {processing_cost}.")
        return processing_cost

# Transport Class
class Transport:
    def __init__(self, env, cost_per_km):
        self.env = env
        self.cost_per_km = cost_per_km

    def transport_coffee(self, distance, amount):
        transport_cost = distance * self.cost_per_km * amount
        yield self.env.timeout(distance / 100)  # Assume 100 km/day travel speed
        print(f"Day {self.env.now}: Transported {amount} tons at cost {transport_cost}.")
        return transport_cost

# Warehouse Class
class Warehouse:
    def __init__(self, capacity):
        self.capacity = capacity
        self.current_storage = 0

    def store_coffee(self, amount):
        if self.current_storage + amount <= self.capacity:
            self.current_storage += amount
            print(f"Stored {amount} tons of coffee. Current storage: {self.current_storage} tons.")
        else:
            print("Warehouse full, cannot store more coffee.")

    def retrieve_coffee(self, amount):
        if amount <= self.current_storage:
            self.current_storage -= amount
            print(f"Retrieved {amount} tons of coffee. Remaining storage: {self.current_storage} tons.")
            return amount
        else:
            print("Not enough coffee in storage.")
            return 0

# Run Simulation
def run_simulation():
    env = simpy.Environment()
    
    farmer = Farmer(env, PRODUCTION_CAPACITY)
    processing_facility = ProcessingFacility(env, PROCESSING_COST_PER_TON)
    transport = Transport(env, TRANSPORT_COST_PER_KM)
    warehouse = Warehouse(WAREHOUSE_CAPACITY)
    
    results = {
        "day": [],
        "produced_coffee": [],
        "processed_coffee": [],
        "transport_cost": [],
        "storage": []
    }
    
    while env.now < SIMULATION_TIME:
        coffee_amount = farmer.coffee_ready
        results["produced_coffee"].append(coffee_amount)
        
        processing_cost = yield env.process(processing_facility.process_coffee(coffee_amount))
        results["processed_coffee"].append(coffee_amount)
        
        transport_cost = yield env.process(transport.transport_coffee(TRANSPORT_DISTANCE, coffee_amount))
        results["transport_cost"].append(transport_cost)
        
        warehouse.store_coffee(coffee_amount)
        results["storage"].append(warehouse.current_storage)
        
        farmer.coffee_ready = 0
        results["day"].append(env.now)
        
        yield env.timeout(30)
    
    df_results = pd.DataFrame(results)
    return df_results

# Main Execution
if __name__ == "__main__":
    df_results = run_simulation()
    print(df_results.head())
    df_results.to_csv("coffee_supply_chain_simulation_results.csv", index=False)
    df_results.plot(x="day", y=["produced_coffee", "processed_coffee", "storage"], title="Coffee Supply Chain Simulation")

title: Vietnamese Coffee Supply Chain Simulation
text:
Conclusion
By simulating the Vietnamese coffee supply chain, we can visualize how production cycles, transportation delays, and warehouse capacity limitations impact the overall supply and export performance.
This model can be extended to include seasonal variations like monsoon effects, price fluctuations, or supply chain disruptions for deeper analysis.

title: EVCIM
text: We started by recovering recycled metal from abandoned mattresses. The springs were heated to straighten them and then cut using a plier. This metal was mixed with concrete to create our homemade weight plates.

title: EVCIM
text: We started by recovering recycled metal from abandoned mattresses. The springs were heated to straighten them and then cut using a plier. This metal was mixed with concrete to create our homemade weight plates.

title: EVCIM
text:
Painting the Weights
  

Once the concrete dried, the plates were coated in matte black paint. At this stage, we finalized the 5kg weight plate design. However, we could only produce six at a time.

title: EVCIM
text:
Our Finished Product
  

The result: clean, consistent 5kg concrete weights reinforced with metal. A major milestone, but we weren‚Äôt done yet.

title: EVCIM
text:
Experimenting with Moulds
  

To scale up, we began developing a more consistent mould using recycled plastics. The aim was to perfect a system that would always produce identical weights at a more frequent rate.

title: EVCIM
text:
Drying Rack Innovation
  

We repurposed discarded wooden planks to build a drying rack. This allowed us to cure multiple weights simultaneously and improve our workflow.

title: EVCIM
text:
Behind the Process

  Your browser does not support the video tag. 

This clip shows part of our early-stage process: heating and bending metal taken from mattress springs ‚Äî a key reinforcement element in the final weight.

title: EVCIM
text:
Transport Tactics
  

You might be wondering how we brought the mattresses home‚Ä¶ This is how. Do not try this at home ‚Äî unless you‚Äôre feeling lucky and you have a very good excuse to the guards.

title: EVCIM
text:
Reflection

At the core of the EVCIM project is a belief that fitness should be accessible to everyone. Gym equipment, especially weights, can be expensive ‚Äî but through recycling, creativity, and sheer trial-and-error, we‚Äôve managed to design affordable, functional weights from materials that would‚Äôve ended up in landfills.


We‚Äôre not just making plates ‚Äî we‚Äôre building a movement where passion meets sustainability. And we‚Äôre not stopping until everyone can train, lift, and grow without breaking the bank. If you want to check out our Instagram, click the icon below.


Have an idea or want to collaborate? Let‚Äôs chat.
